snippet: The eight-story-high neon sign will be removed, according to a city permit, but a broker who represents the owners of the building where the sign sits said they have no plans to demolish it.
abstract: Brian Kanarek, real estate broker who represents owner of Brooklyn building on which iconic Kentile Sign is perched, says he was told there were no plans to demolish the sign, yet New York City Buildings Dept has approved plans for demolishing sign, news of which spur angry backlash.
lead_paragraph: The eight-story-high neon sign will be removed, according to a city permit, but a broker who represents the owners of the building where the sign sits said they have no plans to demolish it.

headline.main: For Kentile Floors Sign, Star of Brooklyn Skyline, the End Seems Near
headline.print_headline: For Kentile Floors Sign, a Star of Brooklyn’s Skyline, the End Seems Near
